commands.description: Creates a public protection. Anyone can use a Public protection, but no one can protect it.
Password-protect a block. Each time you login you need to enter the password to access it. (if someone else knows the password, they can access it too.

Create a private protection. Private means private: you can also allow other users or groups to access the block as well. This is done by adding them after "private". You can add more than one group and/or user per command. When you prefix a User or Group with an '@', this User/Group will be able to modify the block and add other users. They cannot disable the owner from modifying it.

Modify an existing protection, adding or removing users and/or groups. See /lwc create, the example for private protections. The same syntax is used for this command. There's an additional prefix however. Writing a '-' infront of a User or Group removes the access from the block.
Punch a protection to view information on it.
View the amount of protections you are allowed.
Persistent mode will let you perform your last command on multiple blocks, untill you turn it off.
Select: Select the chest drops go to. On: Enable droptransfers. Off: Disable droptransfers. Status: Display the status of the droptransfers.
